review_title: An amazingly supportive environment for both faculty and students.
pros: The support from staff is amazing. Questions are answered within minutes. They foster professional development in a very positive environment.
cons: The size of the University in general can be overwhelming but the individual colleges and schools are very personalized which makes a big difference.

pros: Nice environment, great people to work with, wonderful benefit package, tuition reduction program for yourself and your family.
cons: Probably the only con is that you have to pay for parking, and parking is not really close to your office so you have to walk quite a bit.

job_title: Research Associate Professor in Tempe, AZ

cons: It is getting more and more difficult to get grants/funding  for research.  Applying for grants takes too much time.  Sometimes, effort that was put to apply for grant does not justify final result.

review_title: Good place to be. If you are looking to stick around Arizona all your life
pros: Sun City, lots of people around
cons: A little too much of sun. The difference between MBA and other courses is a lot. MBA are treated much more superiority and have better facilities, jobs compared to other diciplines

review_title: It's a good experience to be a tutor
pros:
- Working hour is flexible
- Reserved golden badge to attend career fair early

- Work with smart people

- Need to find someone to cover your assigned hours if you cannot make it
- The new procedure to find someone cover your time is harder than before

review_title: experience of a life time to work and learn at the same time
pros: This office assistant job has refined and taught me everything I have come to know of a modern business entity.  This position was the best learning experience for dealing with difficult and unhappy customers in highly stressful situations.
cons: Stressful situations management, micro managing, little upward mobility outlook

review_title: I have worked as a Mathematics grader for 2 semesters & had a great time working there. Overall good work life balance
pros: The work load is manageable and doesn't affect your studies. Also the grading part is pretty simple.
cons: Sometimes you don't get the number of working hours you want. Also at times there is very little time provided to grade.

review_title: Good position but not for the long term
job_title: Assistant Director of Admissions and Recruitment in Tempe, AZ
pros: Tuition reduction for furthering education for wmployees and immediate family. State retirement plan. Reasonable health ins premiums. Good amount of paid vacation and sick time.
cons: No growth opportunity. They provide 'professional development' options that have nothing to do with actual job. People in the position about 2 years before moving on.

review_title: Exciting Company with great team spirit!
pros: Fantastic organization to work for! It's a real environment in which to realise your full potential...if you see an opportunity - go for it!! Learn, grow and feel that you are making a real contribution.
cons: Getting large, so it's hard to make a big positive impact.

pros: The campus is beautiful, the cost of living is low, and there are many activities to do outdoors. ASU has very good information and support for employees.
cons: The problem is that ASU is VERY big university, so it really matters where, with what department and with whom you work.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Tempe, AZ
pros:
Salary is a bit low. 
Need to Work during summer and winter. 
The available research resources is not comparable to top universities.
cons:
Doing research is fun.
 I have been here for 4 years and will graduate this year.
Advisers are nice and helpful.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Tempe, AZ
pros: High tech instruments in ASU help you to research on cutting edge topics. Good management and human resource support. Nice campus.
cons: Arizona whether is very warm during summer, and you cannot have any outdoor activity. Phoenix doesn't have enough fun place to have a happy life, and you have to travel to the other cities.

pros: 4 hour shifts offered great flexibility to accommodate class schedules. Depending on how busy the shift was, you could get paid for 1 hour of work and 3 hours of homework or Netflix.
cons: 6 hour shifts on Friday nights that end at 1am are taxing. Lazy coworkers can cause everyone else to pick up the slack.

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in Tempe, AZ
pros: Great benefits and a sense of energy as the campus is always abuzz with activity. People seem to live up to the mission of ASU to innovate, and employees are well taken care of. My job doesn't involve much supervision, so I enjoy a great deal of freedom.
cons: Easy to get lost in the hubbub.

job_title: Career Development Peer in Tempe, AZ
pros: It was nice, they really worked around your schedule and everyone that I worked with I had a great time with. Overall the staff was very competent and helpful whenever I was stuck
cons: This role isn't a place where you could do your homework if that is what you're looking for in a student job

review_title: Arizona State University is a decent, safe, stable place to work
job_title: Library Assistant Senior in Tempe, AZ
pros:
Classified Staff positions recieve tuition waiver, which basically means that you pay a flat $25 a semester to attend undergrad courses.

Benefits are average, lots of holiday time.
cons:
Dreary, unimaginitive daily and weekly tasks.

Little chance for raise or promotion

pros: In my department, anyway, educational activities are well valued, and emphasis is placed on improving courses. Good support from administration in student conflicts and in professional development.
cons: Limited and unclear routes to promotion. Variation between campuses in the quality of instruction. Always a push to teach more and more students.

pros:
It's a job in a tough economy
Many students seem hungry for learning
Nice campus surroundings
Nice winter weather
Easy to get around
cons:
Large class sizes
Students vary tremendously from very bright to those who don't really belong in college or should have more remedial courses. As a result, one teaches to the middle which loses half the class (those above and those below).

pros: Good benefits package, good work/life balance, some decent managers/executives depending on the department, college atmosphere is nice, winter weather is great
cons: prior CIO destroyed just about all that was positive in their IT area, very negative work environment, autocratic management styles abound, no raises, outsourcing, I miss the ASU of 1999

job_title: Systems Analyst Associate in Tempe, AZ
pros: The people I worked with were the best. Great team, great work ethic.
cons: The pay was terrible. The job security was nill. The politics that drove the departments and how they interacted with each other and their employees was the worst.

pros:
Nice parking lot.
Newer building.

New management makes sweeping policy changes, it is never clear what problem the new changes are solving. 
Policy changes are announced  or implied but written down anywhere creating an on-edge uncomfortable atmosphere. 
Team is kept in the dark, little or no communication.
Promotions and new highers are hard to justify.
Pay is low, and perks are starting to evaporate.

pros: Great job for someone still in school. Your boss is typically a professor, who understands that you have other obligations.

review_title: Good to work for especially if you are an ASU student
job_title: Student Worker III (Computer Science Tutor) in Tempe, AZ

review_title: Disability Resource Center is a great place to work!

pros: It has really friendly international students who put smiles on our faces every single day. It is generally inclusive in all its activities
cons: The offices are open most of the time even when the university is on break which means coming to work even when you should be home relaxing

pros: I know this depends on where exactly on campus you work, but at Barrett Honors College the staff were very friendly and understanding of other school commitments. Lots of room to make it your own and as hands on or off as you can handle.

pros: Friendly, Excellent University, Get to meet people from different cultural background. Good pay. Low Arizona taxes is a good thing and the cost of living in Tempe AZ is pretty low.

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in Tempe, AZ

Plenty of funding as the school is trying to brand itself as a place for top research
Big school, so there are lots of resources
Academic environment makes it lively and easy to meet people

Salary blows (academia postdoc)
Really hot in summer!

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Tempe, AZ

pros: The university is constantly thinking 5, 10, 15 years ahead. What this mean is there is plenty of work that needs to be done. In addition to all the work, there are great people to do the work with.

review_title: Bad location, expensive parking, horrible benefits
pros: Living in Tempe is relatively cheap, and you can meet some interesting people at ASU. During the winter the weather is nice. Lots of business services are automated.
cons: Expensive parking with bad public transportation. Horrible atmosphere. Bad job prospects. People don't take you seriously. Summer is outrageously hot.

pros: It is really nice to work as a teaching assistant here. Lots of opportunities to discuss with students about their problems, which in turn improves me a lot.
cons: Sometimes there might be too much work to do which makes me feel tired. I cannot think of other cons besides this.

review_title: Great if you looking for a comfortable job with good benefits including tuition, low salary
pros: Flexible with schedule, lots of sick leave, great benefits

pros: As a student worker, they are very understanding about student classes and homework loads. Work is very close to my classes and apartment.

pros: Great healthcare, tuition waivers, paid time off. Beautiful campus, intellectually stimulating environment.

pros: Extremely flexible scheduling, which is great for students. Management understands that education takes priority. Awesome staff, fun to interact with veterans coming into the center.

pros: The institution is strong - continuing to innovate and advance in research and higher education.  An exciting place place to work and be able to experience such amazing student growth!

pros: As a student worker I was respected and learnt a lot from my manager.

review_title: Rewarding experience with room for networking and growth

Some people you interact with (students, coworkers, faculty) may be very unmotivated

pros:

review_title: Arizona provides numerous opportunities for its students at a reasonable cost.

a lot of work, compared with similar jobs.
